sen.j: 京極東宝（きょうごくとうほう）は、かつて京都府京都市中京区新京極四条に所在していた東宝系の映画館である。
sen.e: Kyogoku Toho is one of the Toho-affiliated movie theaters, which was located at Shinkyogoku Shijo, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyogoku Toho is a Toho-affiliated movie theater that was located in Shinkyogoku Shijo, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyogoku Toho is a Toho-affiliated movie theater that was located in Shinkyogoku Shijo, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 前身は1911年創業の「三友倶楽部」。
sen.e: The forerunner of Kyogoku Toho, 'Sanyu Club,' was founded in 1911.
1911: The 'Sanyu Club,' which was the forerunner of Kyogoku Toho, was founded.
sen.cmt: I've changed this to match the style used in the following cells as it looks more natural in English.
sen.e: 1911: The 'Sanyu Club,' which was the forerunner of Kyogoku Toho, was founded.

sen.j: 1915年火事により焼失するが、1916年「三友劇場」として再開場（1945年閉館）。
sen.e: Although it was burnt down in 1915, it re-opened as 'Sanyu Theater' in 1916 (and closed down in 1945).
1916: The 'Sanyu Club' re-opened under the name the 'Sanyu Theater' in 1916, having burnt down in 1916 (it later closed down in 1945).
1916: The 'Sanyu Club' re-opened under the name the 'Sanyu Theater' in 1916, having burnt down in 1916 (it later closed down in 1945).

sen.j: 1954年12月19日：洋画ロードショー劇場として「京極東宝劇場」オープン。
sen.e: December 19, 1954: 'Kyogoku Toho Theater' opened as a first-run theater for foreign films.
December 19, 1954: 'Kyogoku Toho Theater' opened as a first-run theater for foreign films.
December 19, 1954: 'Kyogoku Toho Theater' opened as a first-run theater for foreign films.

sen.j: 1973年7月：ビル全面改築を行い再オープン（当時の座席数は418席）。
sen.e: July 1973: It re-opened after complete renovation (with seating capacity of 418 at that time).
July 1973: It re-opened after a complete renovation (with a seating capacity of 418 at that time).
July 1973: It re-opened after a complete renovation (with a seating capacity of 418 at that time).

sen.j: 1996年7月：「京極東宝2」「京極東宝3」を新設。
sen.e: July 1996: 'Kyogoku Toho 2' and 'Kyogoku Toho 3' opened.
July 1996: 'Kyogoku Toho 2' and 'Kyogoku Toho 3' opened.
July 1996: 'Kyogoku Toho 2' and 'Kyogoku Toho 3' opened.

sen.j: 2005年9月：閉館を発表。
sen.e: September 2005: It was announced that Kyogoku Toho would close.
September 2005: It was announced that Kyogoku Toho would close.
September 2005: It was announced that Kyogoku Toho would close.

sen.j: 2006年1月28日～1月29日：「街（かわらまち）の灯よ、ありがとう」と題したラストショーを京都宝塚会館と共に開催し閉館。
sen.e: January 28 to 29, 2006: The last show titled 'Machi (Kawaramachi) no hi yo, arigato (Thank you and goodbye to our city lights)' was performed at Kyogoku Toho together with Kyoto Takarazuka Theater before they closed.

January 28 and 29, 2006: The last show, titled 'Machi (Kawaramachi) no hi yo, arigato (Thank you, and Goodbye to Our City Lights),' was performed at Kyogoku Toho together with Kyoto Takarazuka Theater before they closed.

January 28 and 29, 2006: The last show, titled 'Machi (Kawaramachi) no hi yo, arigato (Thank you, and Goodbye to Our City Lights),' was performed at Kyogoku Toho together with Kyoto Takarazuka Theater before they closed.

sen.j: 最後の上映作品は『enRiver of No Return』であった。
sen.e: The last film shown was "River of No Return."
The last film shown was "River of No Return."
The last film shown was "River of No Return."

sen.j: また、高知市にあった同じ東宝系の映画館「高知東宝1・2・3」も同じ日に閉館している。
sen.e: Also, 'Kochi Toho 1, 2, and 3,' another Toho-affiliated movie theater in Kochi City, closed on the same day.
Also, 'Kochi Toho 1, 2, and 3,' another Toho-affiliated movie theater in Kochi City, closed on the same day.
Also, 'Kochi Toho 1, 2, and 3,' another Toho-affiliated movie theater in Kochi City, closed on the same day.

sen.j: 2008年12月11日：京極東宝跡地にホテルビジネスホテル「スーパーホテル京都・四条河原町」がオープンした。
sen.e: December 11, 2008: 'Super Hotel Kyoto Shijokawaramachi,' a business hotel, opened on the Kyogoku Toho site.
December 11, 2008: 'Super Hotel Kyoto Shijokawaramachi,' a business hotel, opened on the Kyogoku Toho site.
December 11, 2008: 'Super Hotel Kyoto Shijokawaramachi,' a business hotel, opened on the Kyogoku Toho site.

sen.j: 各館の特徴
sen.e: Features of theater
Features of the theaters
Features of the theaters

sen.j: ※地下1階に1が、4階に2と3がビル内にあった。
sen.e: Theater 1 was located on the first basement floor, and Theater 2 & 3 on the 4th floor of the building.
Theater 1 was located on the first basement floor, and theaters 2 & 3 were on the fourth floor of the building.
Theater 1 was located on the first basement floor, and theaters 2 and 3 were on the fourth floor of the building.

sen.j: 座席数はすべて閉館時のものである。
sen.e: The seating capacity in each theater is the number recorded at the time of closure.
The seating capacity in each theater is the number recorded at the time of closure.
The seating capacity in each theater is the number recorded at the time of closure.

sen.j: 常に洋画と、ヒット予想の高い邦画を上映。
sen.e: It was always showing foreign films, as well as Japanese films that would sell well.
It specialized in foreign films as well as Japanese films, which sold well.
It specialized in foreign films as well as Japanese films, which sold well.

sen.j: 終盤期には、主にTOHOシネマズスカラ座系の作品を上映していた。
sen.e: In the closing days, it was mainly showing films of TOHO Cinemas Scalaza.

sen.j: ※各館とも最末期はドルビーデジタルとデジタル・シアター・システムズに対応していた。
sen.e: Each theater was compatible with Dolby Digital and Digital Theater Systems in the final phase of its operation.
